txt.en: 'That is the city of Minas Morgul. Once it was Minas Ithil, the Tower of the Moon, but no longer. Do you see the arched structure that crosses the river to the east? That is the bridge we must destroy if we are to keep the foes from the Morgul Vale from crossing into Ithilien.\n\n'Let us rejoin Aragorn, [placeholder].'
Angbor has spoken to Aragorn and Mithrandir about an important matter concerning the Morgul Vale.
'The smoke of their burning is foul, [placeholder], but it will pose less harm than leaving those evil blooms would have done. Let us press forward!'
'It is strange, is it not, to think that dark citadel was built by the hands of Men?'
'Well, that indeed takes care of one problem.'
'I know not for what purpose these flowers grow here.'
'Hold a moment. Something is not right.'
'Burn these noisome blooms so their evil cannot spread to the others!'
'Come with me, [placeholder]. Aragorn, we will meet you at the bridge.'
'These lands once belonged to Gondor, but the corruption of Mordor has befouled them.'
'I feel eyes upon us, [placeholder]. Remain watchful.'
'Aragorn, we are not alone. Remain on your guard.'
'I feel a watchful presence. It hates us, and it fears us. We must be quick!'
Talk to Mithrandir at the overlook.
Make for the bridge near Minas Morgul
Follow Mithrandir to the bridge nearest Minas Morgul

'We must not tarry here. That dark citadel was once Minas Ithil, the Tower of the Moon, but it has not been called by that name for a terrible span of years. It is the fortress of the Nazg√ªl now, and none dare go that way.\n\n'Thanks to the power and wisdom of Mithrandir, our work this day will make it more difficult for our foes to assail Gondor by this road, and that is a work done well.'

'Our destination lies further ahead, [placeholder], but I ask that you take a moment to hear my counsel.\n\n'The flowers that line the road have fallen to some corruption, prey for some dark force. I suggest that we burn these evil blooms in order to prevent their spread beyond the vale into Ithilien and Gondor.'

'Well, that indeed takes care of one problem. It seems that we may have another one, of sorts.\n\n'Did you notice the flowerse growing in the Morgul Vale? Perhaps you did not, but no doubt you smelled them. Yes, the flowers themselves are the cause of that stench, and I mistrust everything about them. Let us take no chances. They should be burned, and quickly!'
Set fire to the noisome flowers.
'Let us return, my friend. We have done what we could, and should tarry no longer.'
